title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.4 | 1-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: There is a need for the science of Krishna in human society for all the suffering humanity of the world.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of discussion, verse 4 of the 12th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, and emphasizes the importance of the science of Krishna for the well-being of humanity, referencing Srila Prabhupada's vision.

segments.key_quote: Srila Prabhupada as the Acharya is thinking about the well-being of every living entity in this entire world.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's concern for all living beings and how Acharyas, particularly Srila Prabhupada, share this concern and advocate for the science of Krishna to benefit the world, especially if leaders participate.

segments.key_quote: The king represents all living beings.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the examples of Maharaj Yudhishthira and Ramachandra as ideal kings and explains the meaning of the word 'Praja' to encompass all living beings, not just humans.

segments.key_quote: Every one of them is a part and parcel of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Bhagavad Gita to emphasize that all living beings are part of the Supreme Lord and that a true leader should provide protection to all, contrasting this with the current demoralized system of administration.

segments.key_quote: By knowing the science of Krishna one can become the most perfect man in the world.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the science of Krishna is essential for becoming a perfect person and that academic qualifications are useless without it, highlighting the importance of devotional service for leaders.

segments.key_quote: He wants to free all the people from the shackles of material suffering.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that devotional service is not sectarian and is meant for every human being, highlighting Maharaj Yudhishthira's desire to free people from material suffering and his administration based on the good of the citizens.

segments.key_quote: Modern day administrators they rule the world based on giving sense gratification to the people and that is demoniac.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the demoniac principle of sense gratification with the ideal of serving Krishna, explaining that serving Krishna includes serving all living beings as parts and parcels of the whole.

segments.key_quote: When one renders service to Krishna who is the complete whole, then all the parts and parcels, the living entities, they are automatically served.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of watering the root of a tree to explain that serving Krishna automatically serves all living beings, emphasizing that Yudhishthira Maharaj's administration ensured both comfort in this life and progress in the next, concluding the lecture with thanks and Hare Krishna.
